intro: Erigeron supplex, commonly known as the Downy Fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and meadows, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The flowers are usually white to pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and bloom from late summer into early autumn.
